meanings.definition: Involving or characteristic of a clique.
meanings.sent1: The students in the club were very cliquy, always sitting together at lunch.
meanings.sent2: Her cliquy behavior made it hard for new people to join the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The cliquy group of friends only invited each other to their parties.
meanings.sent4: The workplace felt cliquy, with certain employees forming tight-knit circles.
meanings.sent5: The garden was cliquy, with different flowers sticking together in clusters.

meanings.sent1: The exclusive club was very cliquy, only allowing certain members to join.
meanings.sent2: She noticed how cliquy the popular girls were, always excluding others from their activities.
meanings.sent3: The cliquy behavior of the team made it hard for new players to feel welcome.
meanings.sent4: The neighborhood was cliquy, with each street forming its own tight-knit community.
meanings.sent5: The forest animals were cliquy, sticking to their own groups and territories.
